item.title: Jpadkins C Style Guidelines
item.description: Introduction Here I describe a style I like to adhere to when writing C. It borrows a lot from existing styles like Kernel and GNU and tries to incorporate rules from both with an emphasis on readability. Along with syntax guidelines, I also describe a structure for ordering and labelling the contents of source and header files. For anything that I don’t specifically cover here, I generally use the Kernel style conventions.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a programming enthusiast from the DFW area. I generally go by jpadkins or jacobpadkins online. If you see someone with that name, there’s a good chance it’s me. I’ve got a thing for webdev, Ruby, C, CRPGS, Roguelikes, cult/exploitation/B films, old pulp sci-fi and fantasy novels, comparative mythology, and IRL exploration, so that’s what you can expect me to write about. Mostly. Q & A Q: Why does your website look like it was designed by someone in the 90s?
